title: I try my hand...
content:
Hi! this is my first post on this forum. I have been a fan of the Keen games(especially 4) for as long, as I can remember.
So, recently I have gotten back into them and played them all over and over again. I played them until I wanted more and more of them, but, of course, 7 was cancelled!!![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img]
But luckily, I even more recently found this site and all the other great Keen sites and mods!!!
So, to make a long story short, I'm gonna try my hand at modding. I can't get modkeen to work on my computer, so I guess I'll use Keenmakeover. It's gonna be really simple since I just got it, and this is my first one, so don't expect anything too nice(in fact, expect something bad![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] ) If I enough time (with all my homework and such) I should have it done in about a week! Thanks for all the great mods, don't bother with mine[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] !

title: Re: I try my hand...
content:
Hello, and welcome.
It's nice to hear you're going to make a mod, good luck. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
To note, modkeen and Keen MakeOver are completely different programs. With modkeen you can edit the sprites and tiles (graphics), and with Keen MakeOver you can edit the levels. So, modkeen is vital. But to be honest, Keen MakeOver isn't good program at all. It has many flaws and bugs. It crashes often etc.. I'd suggest using KeenWright (usually called KeenEdit) by adurdin. It's the best editor out there in my opinion. You can download it here:
[url=http://dosclassics.com/download/190/dl]dosclassics.com/download/190/dl[/url]
As for modkeen, try to get it working. What does it say, when it doesn't work? You may be giving it the wrong input.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: I try my hand...
content:
Well, I know that Keenmakeover basically stinks, and you can't
make tiles or a new map or anything with it, but except for the
bugs it looked the simplest to use so I decided to try it out...
As for modkeen, I think I'll have to get around to reading the directions for it to see what I'm doing wrong(I hate reading directions(: !!)
For now I think I'll just try to struggle through my first thing with Keenmakeover.
Thanks for the help.

title: Re: I try my hand...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]and you can't[hr][/quote]

You can't do that with any lvl editor...

And modkeen; this is the tutorial I gave Mr. 12k, and Bp. It always works 4 those who can't get modkeen to work:

1) Copy all the modkeen files into your Keen Directory

2) Open up notepad

3) Enter the following (This is for Keen 1, just change the number to fit the Keen Episode of your choice):
[quote]Quote:[hr]modkeen -episode=1 -export[hr][/quote]

4) Save it as "Import.bat"

5) Run "Import.bat"

6) Now you have all the sprites

7) Right click on "Import.bat"

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] Delete everything, and enter the following:
[quote]Quote:[hr]modkeen -episode=1 -import[hr][/quote]

9) Save, and close

10) Now you may use "Import.bat" to copy your new graphics back into Keen by just double clicking.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I like KeenWright. Trust me; it works. KeenEdit is also easy to use. Keenmakeover is actually harder IMKO (In My Keenest Opinion [PCKF Slang]).

The modkeen instructions I gave you always work. If you have a problem, then tell me, cause then I wrote the .bat wrong for you.Tough Guys Can Fix Their Own Problems!!!
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/Prisoner.jpg[/img]
*Under Self Inflicted Posting Restriction*
Visit My site at [url=http://www.najawa.com]www.najawa.com[/url]
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Najawa]Click Here!!! Please!!![/url]
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: I try my hand...
content:
I liked the old modkeen, it was simpler.

Try getting the modpack [url=http://www.freewebs.com/trixicentral/Modpack.zip][Here!];[/url] it contains a working version of modkeen [Keens 1-3 only!] a level editor, tile properties editor, and a collection of patches. Just copy and paste the contents of the Keen you want to mod into the 'My Mod' folder and start modding!

title: Re: I try my hand...
content:
Thanks everybody!
After having another bug problem with makeover, I've decided to ditch it and experiment with the mods you guys have shown me (of course if I get anything interesting it won't be for a long time!) If I have a chance someday (hopefully before too long) I might try to make a mod with one of them, or make a text game with a nice little text program I found...
I wish I had more time for stuff like this(if you actually figure it out it can be really fun!), but I really have to keep up with alot of other things. I go to a small Christian private school (with a few smart students, but most of them are pretty average students,) and I get to try and keep my average above all of theirs[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] !
Thanks for all the help, modding looks really fun[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] !

title: I Remember!
content: Sigh [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] , I remember way back in the day... when i was like 4 or 5... In my grandpa's old office... on hes new DOS... the good ol' summer nights where me and my brother would take turns playing keen, defeating level after level, and also we'd take turns playing digger! oh the good ol' days! how I miss them so! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] . I Wanna Go BACK!!!!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:">

content:
